publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-2137 Irene Oldfather: Band Aid 20—That the Parliament congratulates Sir Bob Geldof and the Scottish musician, Midge Ure, for organising Band Aid 20, a re-recording of the 1984 single, Do They Know It's Christmas?; applauds the contribution on this recording of all artists, who have given their time free of charge, including Scottish bands, Travis and Snow Patrol; is aware that proceeds of the sales are going towards relief for the Darfur region of Sudan and to combat HIV and AIDS across Africa; notes that more than 300,000 copies of the CD single have been sold in the first week of release alone; acknowledges that the Band Aid Trust has contributed £75 million to famine relief projects across Africa between January 1985 and November 2004; welcomes the Chancellor of the Exchequer, the Right Honourable Gordon Brown MP’s decision to waive VAT on sales of both the new CD single and the newly-released DVD of the original Live Aid concert in 1985, and encourages as many Scottish people as possible to buy a copy of the CD single and make a difference to the lives of many in Africa this Christmas.
